text: On September 2, 2018, a suicide car bombing took place in Mogadishu, Somalia. ==Incident== On September 2, 2018, a car bomb was set off near a government office after being stopped at a checkpoint by military personnel, killing at least 6 people including the 3 soldiers present and injuring 14 other people. It also caused a nearby school to collapse, damaged nearby houses, and blew the roof off a mosque, as well as destroying the targeted building. ==Reaction== Shortly after the attack, the Islamist militant group al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. The group has often targeted the capital with bombings, including a truck bomb in October 2017 that killed 587 people. ==References== Category:2010s in Mogadishu Category:2018 in Somalia Category:2018 murders in Somalia Category:2018 road incidents 2 September 2018 bombing Category:2010s road incidents in Africa Category:21st-century mass murder in Somalia 2 September 2018 bombing Category:Attacks on buildings and structures in 2018 2 September 2018 bombing 2 September 2018 bombing Category:Attacks on government buildings and structures Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in 2018 Category:Mass murder in 2018 2 September 2018 bombing Category:Road incidents in Somalia Category:September 2018 crimes Category:September 2018 events in Africa Category:Suicide bombings in 2018 2 September 2018 Category:Suicide car and truck bombings in Somalia Category:Terrorist incidents in Somalia in 2018 Category:Somali Civil War (2009–present)
